title: 33. The Marcus King Band - The Marcus King Band
text: by DJ Sirvivor This album provides the listener with original sounds that haven't been heard in decades. The first track "Ain't Nothing Wrong With That" sets the tone for an album full of surprises with amazing vocals, jazzy guitar riffs, funky drums & bass, organ & keys that take you straight to church, finish that off with a horn section that James Brown would have begged for & you have yourselves the future of music.Guest musicians include names like Haynes, Trucks, Burbridge, & Smallie which are wish list talent for most.The entire album is a genre bending ride through music that will leave your ears begging for more. Smokin' hot by mo' music! The album is killer!!! Smokin', on fire, red hot!!!! abSOULutely outstanding!!! Soulful, bluesy, funky, Horny, rockin' guitars, guitar duels, Warren & Derek. Marcus' Voice is great, slide is amazing, horns are sw t, band is tight tight tight. Thought soul insight was amazing this is as good as it gets. Fantastic work!!!! Those that love Govt Mule, ABB, TTB will live MKB. Highest of recommends. This is a diamond!!! Marcus King and family by Mpeberling 1st song released/2nd album... Absolutely amazing musicianship! Band sounds tight, production spot on- each note filled with heart and soul---congrats to you and the band Marcus...can't wait to catch you live - ty for sharing your talent with the world Biography Genre: Rock Years Active: '00s, '10s Led by a young artist who plays and sings with an impressive degree of seasoned maturity and passion, the Marcus King Band play a hearty mixture of soul, blues, rock, and jazz, with Marcus King fronting the group on lead vocals and guitar. Marcus King was born in Greenville, South Carolina on March 11, 1996.
